metadata.dc:description: The clinical and histopathological findings of 8 patients with a diagnosis of Churg-Strauss syndrome seen in our institution in a 10 year period have been reviewed. All patients had asthma and hypereosinophilia (mean eosinophil count 7.64 x 10(9); range: 0.748 x 10(9)-31.46 x 10(9) eosinophils/l). The organs and systems involved in the late phase of the syndrome (vasculitic phase) were: nervous system (16 cases), respiratory system (5 cases), skin and subcutaneous tissue (5 cases), heart (3 cases), digestive system (3 cases) and kidney (1 case). The diagnosis was made on the basis of the clinical and histopathological findings. In 7 cases necrotizing angiitis was shown, tissue eosinophilia in 4, and extravascular granulomas in 2. In most cases, corticosteroid therapy resulted in a favorable course, but cyclophosphamide was required in two patients. In the discussion, the evolution of the criteria for the diagnosis of this condition is analyzed.
metadata.dc:title: Síndrome de Churg-Strauss. Ocho casos en los últimos diez años.
[Churg-Strauss syndrome: 8 cases in the last 10 years].
